User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:10.0a2) Gecko/20111203 Firefox/10.0a2
Build ID: 20111203042032

Steps to reproduce:

While browsing our Intranet site, http://intranet.bsnl.co.in, aftter loggin in...


Actual results:

the browser does not show a menu as expected. The browser window can be closed normally but the process runs in the background. Java crashes an an error file is generated which is attached


Expected results:

A menu should have been displayed.

comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
We need a public testcase because we don't know anything about the JVM and the Java plugin internals.
That the Firefox process doesn't close is probably caused by the java plugin itself.

There are 3 different java plugins involved with different browser and browser versions:;

Firefox up to v3.6.x : npoji plugin
IE: Active X Plugin
FF4.0+, Opera(?), chrome: npapi plugin

Did you tested a browser that is using the same npapi plugin ?
comments.raw_text:

FF4.0+, Opera(?), chrome: npapi plugin

Did you tested a browser that is using the same npapi plugin ?

comments.raw_text:
I'm seeing the same issue, starting today. The web application I develop has a Java applet that runs every time you log in. I've been running Nightly for months without problems. Today, the 1 March 2012 Nightly, gives me the same issue on out web application and on other sites using Java.

I'm not seeing the problem with Firefox 11, and I wasn't seeing the problem with Nightly yesterday. I do see the problem on a clean profile. I do see the problem in Safe Mode.

Operating System: Windows XP
Version: 13.0a1
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.2; WOW64; rv:13.0) Gecko/20120301 Firefox/13.0a1

Steps to reproduce:

o Create a new profile and run the 1 March 2012 Nightly.
o Visit http://csis.pace.edu/~bergin/Java/applets.htm

-> A Java console appears and in a couple of seconds displays the message at the end.

o Exit Nightly.

-> Sometimes Nightly exits correctly and the Java console goes away, sometimes the Java console stays open and the Nightly process sticks around until killed.

Java Plug-in 1.6.0_31
Using JRE version 1.6.0_31-b05 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
User home directory = C:\Documents and Settings\bjherbison

----------------------------------------------------
c:   clear console window
f:   finalize objects on finalization queue
g:   garbage collect
h:   display this help message
l:   dump classloader list
m:   print memory usage
o:   trigger logging
q:   hide console
r:   reload policy configuration
s:   dump system and deployment properties
t:   dump thread list
v:   dump thread stack
x:   clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to <n>
----------------------------------------------------

load: class GSort.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: GSort.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: GSort.class
